question.text: In RAAS mechanism of kidney regulation, angiotensin II increases the blood volume and blood pressure by:

options.text: Activating adrenal cortex to release aldosterone hormone.
Signalling renal tubule of nephron to reabsorb more NaCl and water.
Causing relaxation of glomerular blood vessels or arterioles.

solution.text: Angiotensin II is an octa-peptide chemical and is one of the most potent vaso-constrictors which increases blood pressure and thus GFR by constricting the arterioles. It also stimulates the adrenal cortex to release aldosterone hormone. This aldosterone causes reabsorption of NaCl and water from renal tubule of the nephron.
